text.p: Write a piece of Python code that uses a loop (while or for) to sum the odd integers from 1 through end, inclusive. end is a variable that we define for you. So, for example, if we define end to be 7, your code should print out the result: Sum of odd numbers: 16, which is 1 + 3 + 5 + 7.
Hint: There are two different approaches to this problem.Either have a loop that only goes through odd numbers, or test at each iteration whether the number is odd or even.

For problems such as these, do not include input statements or define the variables we give you. Our automated testing will provide values for you, so write your code in the following box assuming they are already defined.

codeparam.answer_display:
total = 0 i = 1 while i <= end: total += i i += 2 print 'Sum of odd numbers: ', total
OR
total = 0 for i in range(1, end+1, 2): total += i print "Sum of odd numbers:", total

p.b: During the actual exam, you will only see one or two test cases.
